title: Microsoft, Las Vegas Sands, AMC: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Stock futures are up, indicating a tepid rebound for major indexes
text:
* Stocks in U.S. casino companies are down premarket after the Macau government set expectations for the future of the gambling industry there, including increased regulatory scrutiny over casino operations. Shares of Las Vegas Sands declined 5.1%, Wynn Resorts shed 5.4% and MGM Resorts International fell 1.5%.

* Sonim Technologies slumped more than 30% premarket after the company said it plans to effect a 1-for-10 reverse stock split at 5 p.m. ET on Sept. 15. The company said the reverse stock split is intended to increase its share price and ensure it regains compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid price requirement.

* Shares of Theravance Biopharma plummeted 20% after the company said it would immediately initiate a significant cost reduction program, including a 75% reduction in head count.

* Oil company shares gained premarket as oil prices climbed, driven in part by disruption to output caused by Hurricane Ida. More than 39% of oil output in the Gulf of Mexico and 48% of gas output was offline Tuesday, the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement said. Occidental Petroleum added 1.4% premarket while Exxon Mobil gained 1%.

* Yum China Holdings fell more than 4% premarket after the company said that the Delta variant of Covid-19 is having such a wide impact in China that it expects to report significantly lower operating profit in the third quarter.

* Hut 8 Mining's shares fell 11% in premarket trading after the Canadian digital currency miner said it is launching an offering of new shares in the U.S. and Canada.

* AMC Entertainment Holdings, a favorite stock of individual investors, fell 3% premarket. Some other meme stocks also declined premarket, with GameStop down 1.8% and Naked Brand Group down 3.3%.

Chart of the Day

* Americans last year saw their first significant decline in household income in nearly a decade, government data showed.
